parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT can be used for sorting.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system or derived from the variable VISIT. Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit numbering or visit naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In these cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when the SDTM submission datasets are created.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Number
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: VISITNUM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What is the visit number?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Protocol-defined description of the clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The name of the visit is typically pre-printed on the CRF, and should match the name of the visit in the protocol. May be used to derive the SDTM variable VISITNUM. Note: Sponsors may have CDASH visit numbering or visit naming conventions to handle special circumstances (e.g., unscheduled visits). In these cases, the appropriate visit numbers and visit names may need to be populated when the SDTM submission datasets are created.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: VISIT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. A date/time can be collected once for the whole visit using the Visit Date/Time field and applying that date/time to all of the observations at that visit. The date (--DTC) of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components, and populating the STDMIG variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTMIG SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVSTDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISDAT and VISTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Time the clinical encounter took place (or started).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. A date/time can be collected once for the whole visit using the Visit Date/Time field and applying that date/time to all of the observations at that visit. The date (--DTC) of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM). For SDTM submission datasets, concatenate CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components, and populate the STDMIG variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format. May be used to populate SVSTDTC, and SVENDTC in the SDTMIG SV domain.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTMIG SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVSTDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISDAT and VISTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (start) time of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. This is the end date of the visit. This may be useful when a study extends over 2 or more days.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit End Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVENDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISENDAT and VISENTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISENDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the end date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be recorded in either the header of the CRF or in the body of the CRF. This is the end time of the visit, and may be useful when a study extends over 2 or more days.
cdashModelFields.label: Visit End Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM SV dataset, the SDTMIG variable SVENDTC may be derived by concatenating all collected CDASH VISENDAT and VISENTIM components and populating the SDTM variable SVENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: VISENTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the end time of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Name of the trial epoch with which this element of the arm is associated.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate these parts. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG EPOCH Variable Guidance for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Epoch
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: EPOCH
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the [study/trial] [period/phase/sponsor-defined phrase] (for this [event/intervention/finding])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a generic DATE field that can be implemented in a system that will store partial dates. Use this for date of data collection, visit date, visit start date, point-in-time collection (e.g., vital signs measurements, lab sample collection date), or start date for interval collection of measurements or tests (e.g., start date of a 24-hour urine collection). Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guide v2.2a indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) are included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Collection Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable --DTC in ISO 8601 format. Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guidea indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) should be included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.name: --DAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the date the [event or intervention] [is/was] collected?; What [is/was] the (start) date (of the [Finding])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the day the [event or intervention] [is/was] collected?; What [is/was] was the (start) day (of the [Finding])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a generic START DATE field that can be implemented in a system that will store partial dates. Use this for start date of events or interventions (e.g., AE start date, substance use start date), start date of interval dosing (e.g., date/time of infusion start), dates of protocol milestones (e.g., informed consent date), dates of Disposition events (e.g., date of study completion, date of discontinuation).
cdashModelFields.label: Observation Start Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable --STDTC in ISO 8601 format. Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guidea indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) should be included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.name: --STDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([event/intervention]) ([MHEVDTYP]/start/admission) date (of the observation)?

cdashModelFields.label: Observation End Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH End DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable --ENDTC in ISO 8601 format. Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guidea indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) should be included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.name: --ENTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([event/intervention/finding]) ([end/discharge/stop]) time (of the observation)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is a generic END HOUR (ENHR) field that can be implemented in a system that will not store partial times. Use this for end time of events (e.g., AE end time) or Interventions (e.g., CM end time), end time of interval dosing (e.g., time of infusion end), end visit time, end time for interval collection of measurements or tests (e.g., and time of 24-hour urine collection).
cdashModelFields.label: Observation End Hour
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH End DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable --ENDTC in ISO 8601 format. Section 4.1.4.1 of the FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guidea indicates that when dates have the role of a timing variable, the matching Study Day variables (--DY, --STDY, or --ENDY, respectively) should be included in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.name: --ENHR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([event/intervention/finding]) ([end/discharge/stop]) hour (of the observation)?

cdashModelFields.name: --ENMI

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Use only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Duration
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate the collected CDASH duration and the CDASH duration unit components and populate the SDTM variable --DUR in ISO 8601 period format.
cdashModelFields.name: --CDUR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the duration of the [event/intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit of time associated with the collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Use only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Duration Unit
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate the collected CDASH duration and the CDASH duration unit components and populate the SDTM variable --DUR in ISO 8601 period format.
cdashModelFields.name: --CDURU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the duration unit of the [event/intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the event/intervention/finding started or occurred prior to a specified time point.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --PRIOR allows specific question text and prompt about interventions, events or findings that were prior to a specified timepoint. --PRIOR is used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--STTPT, --ENTPT) or the Study Reference Period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Prior
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --STRF or --STRTPT. When populating --STRF, or --STRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --PRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --PRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable --STRF should be populated. When --PRIOR is compared to another timepoint, the SDTM variables --STRTPT and --STTPT should be used. Note: --STRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --STTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRIOR
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [--TRT/Intervention] [taken/performed/used/administered/consumed/started/occurred] prior to a [specified timepoint]?; Did the [--TERM/event topic/--TRT/Intervention/Finding] [start/occur] prior to [specified timepoint]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See --TPTNUM and --TPTREF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Planned time point names are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time point names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header. In the SDTM submission dataset, time points can be represented using the time point variables --TPT, --TPTNUM,-- ELTM. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Planned Time Point Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTM time point anchors --TPTREF (text description) and --RFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTM variables --TPTNUM, --ELTM.
cdashModelFields.name: --TPT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the planned time point [of the/for the] [measurement/observation/collection]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Numeric version of planned time point, used in sorting.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Planned time point numbers may be needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. If collected, it is recommended that time point numbers be pre-printed on the CRF. In the SDTM submission dataset, time points can be represented using the time point variables --TPT, --TPTNUM,-- ELTM. See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Planned Time Point Number
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTM time point anchors --TPTREF (text description) and --RFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTM variables --TPTNUM, --ELTM.
cdashModelFields.name: --TPTNUM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the planned time point number [of the/for the] [measurement/observation/collection]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by --ELTM, --TPTNUM, and --TPT.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Planned reference point referred to by time point variables --TPT, TPTNUM, --ELTM. See SDTMIG for additional information. This would most commonly be pre-specified on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer.
cdashModelFields.label: Time Point Reference
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TPTREF
cdashModelFields.questionText: What is the description of the fixed reference point?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Date for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Date of the fix reference time point defined by --TPTREF
cdashModelFields.label: Reference Time Point Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the SDTMIG variable --RFTDTC is derived by concatenating all collected CDASH --RFTDAT, and --RFTTIM components and populating the SDTM variable --RFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: --RFTDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the date of the [Reference Time point]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Time of the fix reference time point defined by --TPTREF
cdashModelFields.label: Reference Time Point Time
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the SDTMIG variable --RFTDTC is derived by concatenating all collected CDASH --RFTDAT, and --RFTTIM components and populating the SDTM variable --RFTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: --RFTTIM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the time of the [Reference Time point]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected or pre-populated text description of an interval associated with an observation such as a finding --TESTCD.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --CEVINT (which is stored as free text) indicates a period of time during which an observation is being made or about which a question is being asked (e.g., "During the past 6 months what was the subject's average sleep time?" or "Record any significant cardiovascular medical history over the subject's lifetime."). The evaluation interval free text is defaulted in the hidden CDASH field --CEVINT (e.g., PAST 6 MONTHS, LIFETIME). Intervals that can be converted to ISO format (e.g., PAST 6 WEEKS), are mapped to the SDTM variable --EVLINT (-P6W), and free-text interval are mapped to --EVINTX (LIFETIME). See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Collected Evaluation Interval
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, convert the collect evaluation interval into an ISO 8601 period format and populate the SDTM variable --EVLINT or if the interval can not be converted to an ISO format, populate the SDTM variable --EVINTX.
cdashModelFields.name: --CEVINT
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Included as part of a protocol-specified question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Duration of interval associated with an observation, such as a finding --TESTCD.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --EVLINT indicates a period of time during which an observation is being made or about which a question is being asked which is represented in an ISO format. This would be a hidden field on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. The evaluation interval is included in the question text and the hidden CDASH field --EVLINT is defaulted using the appropriate ISO format for the interval. Example: "During the past 6 months, what was the subject's average sleep time?" is the question text; the hidden CDASH field --EVLINT would be "-P6M". See SDTMIG for additional information.
cdashModelFields.label: Evaluation Interval
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --EVLINT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable. It is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTM variables DTHDTC and DTHFL are mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains (e.g., DS), as deemed appropriate by the sponsor. Death Date can be collected as a single field, or as three fields (DTHMO, DTHDD and DTHYY).
cdashModelFields.label: Death Date
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DM.DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.
cdashModelFields.name: DTHDAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2
